text: hey all! new to using HubDB and looking for some examples to reference or some direction

the limit on a HubDB is 10,000 rows and I am building a product catalog that will exceed that. i’m setting up separate DBs for each manufacturer with product data as separate rows. is it possible to display this on a page so that the user can view by category (therefore accessing roughly 50 different HubDBs)
There’s a bunch under Tutorials at <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs>
thanks! i did see a few tutorials over there like the real estate listing example, but it seems to be contained to a single HubDB. I’m trying to learn how to connect multiple DBs
You would just use a different table id based on your category
ah so just to make sure i understand
i have my categories in a separate table. on the dynamic page template, i can pull in all products that are tagged “Furniture” across every DB?
There is a new feature coming out soon that will allow you to organize your tables into categories like above.
In the mean time, you would have to create separate dynamic pages for each category
